image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives, Gift of the U.S. Association of Former Members of Congress

profileText: A Representative from California; born in Dallas, Tex., September 3, 1947; attended public and private schools; B.A., B.S., Stanford University, 1970, M.B.A., Harvard University, 1972; chairman of a film production company; deputy assistant secretary for negotiations policy, Department of Defense, 1986-1987; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Third Congress (January 3, 1993-January 3, 1995); was not a candidate for reelection in 1994, but was an unsuccessful candidate for election to the United States Senate.

researchRecord.name: 1994, 13 commercials on 10 videoreels and 11 commercials on 2 videocassettes.
researchRecord.description: The commercials were used during Michael Huffington's campaign for the 1994 U.S. senatorial election in California, Republican Party.

recordLocation.name: The Julian P. Kanter Political Commercial Archive, Department of Communication

researchRecord.name: In the John Stanton Political Campaign Collection, 1860-2007, amount unknown.
In the Robert J. Lagomarsino Collection: Federal Collection, 1974-1992, 200 linear feet.
